alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 2:51PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Etowah County through 330 PM CDT... At 251 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gadsden Mall, or near Gadsden. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Reece City, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Gadsden Steam Plant, Big Wills Creek, Gadsden Municipal Airport, Gadsden Water Works, Northside and Ramsey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
